rows.text: Formed by merger of St. Francis Xaviers College (Marist Brothers) for boys and St Josephs College (Mercy Sisters) for girls. The College now Caters for Boys and Girls, Years 8 to 12 on the site of the old Marist Brothers College (St Francis Xavier)
Formed by merger of St. Patrick's College for Year 7 to Year 12 boys and Our Lady of Sion College for Year 7 to Year 12 girls
It was selected, for the fourth time in a row, as one of the "Top 50 Catholic High Schools" in the United States by the Catholic High School Honor Roll in 2008.
Also houses a support program for youths with special needs
Colegio Marista San Vicente de Paúl
Kindergarten, Primary and Secondary school (High School)
Closed 1996. School founded in 1952 by Brothers of Charity (St. Vincent de Paul), then taken by Marists Brothers (1969), and now under the Agustines OSA since 1997.
Colegio San José Maristas del Callao
Kindergarten, Primary School and High School
Closed 1972. Aka: Col·legi Sant Josep (related to the street's name where it was located).
Instituto Liceal Dom Gonçalo da Silveira
Kindergarten, Primary, Junior and High school
Founded in 1972 as a transfer from St. Mary's Sec School in Lukosi, Hwange. St Mary's Secondary School was an old Catholic School run by the priests of the Hwange Diocese
All Girls Intermediate and High school
While still retaining some Marist brothers in the faculty, no longer officially a Catholic college
Founded by merger of Stella Maris Regional College and Marist College (Burnie)
Founded by Br. Bernard Curtin, F.M.S.
Founded by merger of St. Josephs & Our Lady of Sion Colleges
Kindergarten, Primary School, and High School
Founded in 1985/1986 by Brother Clarence Cunningham
Was founded on two separate sites, then become one college in 2006
First Marist school in the Philippines
Our Lady and St. Chad Sports College

The original school founded in 1928 was a boy's grammar school called St. Chad's College. Around 1978 it amalgamated with its 'sister' school for girls and became Our Lady and St. Chad comprehensive school. Some years later, it was renamed Our Lady and St. Chad Catholic Sports College
Our Lady of Lourdes High School
The oldest and most computered marist school.
Founded by merger of St. Joseph's College and Redden Catholic College
Boys only school running from second class to sixth class
St. Joseph's College, East Brunswick / North Fitzroy
Two campuses. Founded by the merger of Benedict College (Auburn), St John's Girls' High (Auburn), and St Peter Chanel Girls' High
Unidad Educativa Colegio Nuestra Señora De Chiquinquira H.H Maristas
First Marist School in the Venezuelan country
Founded in 1989 as Universidad La Salle Guadalajara. In August 1997, due to the immense growth, it moves to another site, where it stays until 2003, when it moved to its actual site.
